repnme.cdata!: China - Micro and Small Enterprise Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Micro and Small
            Enterprise Finance Project for China were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development outcome was
            low; Bank performance was satisfactory and the borrower
            performance was also satisfactory. Some lessons learned
            includes: from the perspective of the Participating
            Financial Institution's (PFIs), it was important to
            learn first and then adopt later with good understanding. A
            number of interviewed institutions mentioned that they had
            adopted an attitude of learning from consultants, but did
            not make rapid changes to the technologies transferred by
            the consultants before fully comprehending their
            implications. The selection should be based mainly on the
            understanding and commitment from top management on Micro
            and Small Enterprise (MSE) lending and overall management of
            the bank, rather than focusing solely on the current
            performance of a bank. External factors could play an
            important role in a MSE project. The strong performance of
            the country's economy, while exerting a positive
            effect, resulted in funding availability among the PFIs,
            which did not have the incentive to borrow from sub-loan
            with high funding costs of the China Development Bank (CDB)
            that hindered its ability to on-lend to these PFIs.

repnme.cdata!: China - Micro and Small Enterprise Finance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The China Micro and Small Enterprise
            Finance Project will support the Government's priority
            program to catalyze the expansion of commercial lending to
            the emerging segment of medium-sized enterprises (MSEs) that
            are strongly competitive and privately owned, but in need of
            funds for working and investment capital. The project also
            aims to strengthen the capacity of banks to provide lending
            to MSEs on a mass-market and profitable basis.  The project
            consists of two closely linked components: (i) a Credit
            Facility for on-lending to eligible units; and (ii) a
            Technical Assistance Facility to support capacity building.

repnme.cdata!:
China - Micro and Small Enterprise Finance
            Project : environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
The micro and small enterprises finance
            project for China considers that environmental soundness of
            the project is an integral part of the business unit's
            responsibilities. The environmental issues involved in the
            project are generally clear and insignificant and,
            therefore, the environmental management of the project is
            relatively simple, a totally separate environmental
            management system is not necessary. An environmental
            management system which is embedded in the project
            management system and makes full use of existing project
            management resources is to be established. China Development
            Bank (CDB) will take necessary steps to ensure that
            participating financial institutions (PFIs) put in place
            environmentally sound policies and procedures to enable
            credit officers and other staff to adhere to the pertinent
            Chinese laws and regulations governing environmental
            screening, assessment and reporting in the process of credit
            appraisal and administration. CDB has appointed a senior
            manager to be in charge of environmental issues related to
            the project and furthermore will engage external, certified
            environmental specialists on an as-needed basis, in order to
            support the supervision and monitoring of the PFI's
            compliance with environmental guidelines, training relevant
            PFI staff in environmental issues, and preparing annual
            environmental reporting for the Bank.
